question: Can I afford a mortgage of $300,000 with a $50,000 annual salary and no outstanding debt?
true_answer: Yes, with a $50,000 salary and no debts, you can afford a $300,000 mortgage assuming a 20% down payment and standard loan terms.

steps.content: Can I afford a mortgage of $300,000 with a $50,000 annual salary and no outstanding debt?
Plan: 1) Use home_loan_agent to check affordability criteria. 2) Calculate monthly payments and DTI. 3) Confirm results with supervisor. 4) Deliver final answer.
Retrieving knowledge on mortgage affordability criteria with no outstanding debt.
With no outstanding debt, affordability depends mainly on income and down payment.
Calculating monthly mortgage payments based on a $300,000 mortgage and standard interest rate.
Monthly payment estimated at $1,432 with a 30-year term at 3.5% interest.
Calculating DTI based on annual income of $50,000 and estimated monthly payment.
DTI calculated as 34.4%, which is below the 43% threshold.
Retrieving knowledge on typical down payment percentages.
A standard down payment is usually 20% of the home price.
Review complete, calculations and criteria are accurate.
Yes, with a $50,000 salary and no debts, you can afford a $300,000 mortgage assuming a 20% down payment and standard loan terms.
